before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"eb6ts","text":"General preparation Timing: 1 h 1. Clean Dounce homogenizers and pre-cool them on ice. CRITICAL: If nuclei are to be used for transcriptomics, rinse Dounce homogenizers with RNaseZAP and DEPC-treated water to minimize RNase activity. 2. Pre-cool centrifuges to 4C. 3. Pre-cool tubes for nuclei isolation and Petri dishes for tissue mincing on ice. Note: For each isolation, prepare 13 50 mL tube, 23 5 mL DNA low binding tubes, 23 1.5 mL DNA low binding tubes, and 13 Petri dish. 4. Prepare nuclei isolation buffer (NIB) and nuclei resuspension buffer (NRB). a. Filter buffers using a 0.2 mm syringe filter and pre-cool buffers on ice. Note: Buffers are prepared freshly in order to minimize RNase activity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":87,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":349,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eapae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctv4m","text":"Key activity. Sucrose is prepared freshly in DEPC-treated water. IGEPAL CA-630 solution is diluted in DEPC-treated water and can be stored for several months at 20°C–25°C. BSA is dissolved in 1× PBS (in DEPC-treated water) and can be stored at −20°C. 1× PBS solution is prepared by diluting a 10× PBS solution in DEPC-treated water.","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":283,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":342,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":385,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":422}],"data":{}},{"key":"al8jb","text":"Alternatives: description: {"blocks":[{"key":"hv90","text":"This protocol describes the steps to isolate and obtain total nuclei from frozen mouse white adipose tissues (WAT). We utilized this protocol to obtain nuclei from 4- and 24- month-old mouse epididymal adipose samples. Additionally this protocol can be used for various other murine adipose depots, with adjustment of the final resuspension volume to accommodate variations in the size of the final nuclei pellet as a result of the nuclei yield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69f8j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0aki","text":"Adapted from STAR Protocols - Isolation of nuclei from mouse white adipose tissues for single-nucleus genomics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i99s","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1jmns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","id":423966,"original_name":"Isolation of nuclei from mouse white adipose tissues for single-nucleus genomics.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n8a8b8u6f.pdf"}}}}

groups.title: Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet) Method Development Community

manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"7vglb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mt8g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"erq53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Van Hauwaert EL, Gammelmark E, Sárvári AK, Larsen L, Nielsen R, Madsen JGS, Mandrup S","can_edit":true,"date":1623888000,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.xpro.2021.100612","guid":"E64537AA0C5B444FAF63B4AEC1944C40","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Isolation of nuclei from mouse white adipose tissues for single-nucleus genomics."}}}}

references.title: Isolation of nuclei from mouse white adipose tissues for single-nucleus genomics.
references.authors: Van Hauwaert EL, Gammelmark E, Sárvári AK, Larsen L, Nielsen R, Madsen JGS, Mandrup S

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6imjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9rkb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2f9md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fimlo","text":"Transfer 400 mg of gonadal adipose tissue (or 100 mg of inguinal adipose tissue) to a pre-cooled Petri dish on ice (Figure 1A).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2flvn","text":"To minimize contamination with blood cells from the vasculature, it is recommended to\ndo cardiac perfusion with 13 PBS in DEPC-treated water (typically 12 mL per perfusion) prior\nto isolating the tissue.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fgnj4","text":"Homogenize the tissue to release nuclei by applying 5 strokes with pestle A (loose) followed by 5\nstrokes with pestle B (tight) (Figures 1E and 1F).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hub3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93agv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6e7p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"257sk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"aocdv","text":"CRITICAL: Homogenize carefully to minimize generation of heat and foam, which will\nimpact nuclei intactness.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1e39p","text":"Note: For adipose tissues from obese mice, use the same amount of tissue as for lean tissues, but homogenize in a total volume of 1 mL NIB and apply 10 strokes with pestle A followed by 5 strokes with pestle B.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bq3m","text":"Add 500 µL of NIB and mince the tissue thoroughly (\u003c1 mm3 ) using a scalpel (Figures 1B and 1C). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk0e9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"98mu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"d2pdd","text":"CRITICAL: Nuclei yield will be reduced if the tissue is not finely minced.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hdoc","text":"With the scalpel, transfer the minced adipose tissue to a pre-cooled 7 mL glass Dounce homogenizer on ice (Figure 1D).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f75cr","text":"Pre-wet a 70 µm cell strainer with DEPC-treated water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80jbe","text":"Filter the homogenate through the pre-wetted cell strainer into a pre-cooled 50 mL tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl6vf","text":"Wash the Dounce homogenizer with 1 mL NIB and filter through the same cell strainer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4r4hc","text":"Transfer the filtered homogenate to a pre-cooled 5 mL DNA Low binding tube on ice using a P1000 pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"drtr6","text":"Wash the cell strainer with 1 mL NIB and add to the filtered homogenate in the 5 mL tube to a total volume of \u0004∼2.5 mL using a P1000 pipette (Figure 1G).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4uuh","text":"Centrifuge the homogenate at 1000 x g for 10 min at 4°C using a fixed-angled rotor (Figure 2A). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4las3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c562r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bikhm","text":"Nuclei are located as a smear along the side of the 5 mL tube.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nvbu","text":"Aspirate the lipid layer using a vacuum pump (Figure 2B). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5uoji","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e0ftq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4kbjp","text":"CRITICAL: Only remove the top lipid layer. Do not remove the entire supernatant, as this will lead to loss of nuclei.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c078a","text":"Resuspend the pellet in the remaining supernatant using a P1000 pipette and transfer the resuspended nuclei to a new pre-cooled 5 mL DNA Low binding tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejq0g","text":"To make sure that all nuclei are transferred, wash the first 5 mL tube twice with 1 mL NIB and transfer any remaining nuclei to the new 5 mL tube containing the resuspended nuclei using a P1000 pipette (Figure 2C).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ak4h","text":"Pellet the nuclei by centrifuging at 500 x g for 10 min at 4°C using a swing-bucket rotor (Figure 2D).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5c2nt","text":"Aspirate the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7jrf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9u1ld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ak01n","text":"CRITICAL: Be careful not to disturb the nuclei pellet.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehtol","text":"Resuspend the nuclei pellet in 100 µL NRB by pipetting using a regular P1000 pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bkfu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pi3j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"633ti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a30p5","text":"For 2 yr old mice - pellet was resuspended in 750µL NRB.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"emb7h","text":"Pre-wet a 40 mm tip strainer with NRB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79hcl","text":"Use vacuum aspiration to remove most of the supernatant (leave 80–100 mL supernatant) and remove remaining supernatant with a P100 pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"46m3n","text":"Wash the pellet - Resuspend the nuclei pellet in 750 µL of NIB","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"54jn9","text":"Pellet the nuclei by centrifuging at 500 x g for 10 min at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn1j9","text":"Filter the nuclei through the pre-wetted tip strainer using a P1000 pipette into a pre-cooled 1.5 mL DNA Low binding tube on ice (Figure 2E) to remove any remaining debris and avoid nuclei aggregation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea69n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4rqaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9ik6s","text":"The nuclei concentration will decrease by 30%–40% following filtration.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"skth","text":"Proceed to nuclei counting using a Bürker counting chamber and Trypan Blue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bsrkk","text":"Mix nuclei and Trypan Blue in equal ratio in a separate tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bds0j","text":"Transfer 10 µL of the nuclei-Trypan Blue solution to the Bürker counting chamber. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c762j","text":"Count at least 3 squares using bright-field microscopy and quantify the nuclei concentration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5nsv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3mfkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31jk4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"frkht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q3l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4dva4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"","id":0}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7pq0b","text":"If nuclei are diluted while counting, multiply the equation for calculating the concentration of nuclei with the dilution factor. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"c5pca","text":"CRITICAL: Verify that nuclei are mostly intact and not clumping (Figures 3A and 3B). Note,\nthat intact nuclei isolated from adipose tissues have a heterogenic morphology.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Isolation of nuclei from mouse white adipose tissues for single-nucleus genomics --University of Minnesota TMCs
